title: Randy plumber 'caught having sex with another man’s wife on customer’s sofa'
text:

A plumber was busted after getting frisky with another man's wife while he was supposed to be installing a family's new bathroom.

Tradesman, Mike Wilson, 42, was employed by the unsuspecting Williams' but they didn't like the overtime he was putting in.

Wilson, a former school friend of Michael Williams, 34, was given a set of house keys so he could complete the work while they were away in Turkey.

But Michael and wife Becca, 31, returned from holiday and noticed a crate of beer was missing - so they checked their home CCTV.

The camera installed in their living room window and pointing to the drive outside and recorded explicit audio of what sounds like two people having sex, report The Sun .

(Image: Facebook)

It shows Mike arriving with a mystery woman, and later a man can be heard asking intimate sexual questions before recording X-rated "slapping and sex noises".

Mike can then be seen leaving the house with a blonde woman - his alleged 37-year-old mistress.

When he discovered the footage Michael confronted her on Facebook - and also sent the CCTV footage to her husband.

Furious Michael, a cleaner, from Kendal, Cumbria, said: "He’s not getting paid for the job because we now need a new sofa. It has put quite a lot of stress on the family.

"I was absolutely speechless and thought how low can you get.

"The whole idea was to have a friend do the work because we wanted someone we could trust. Becca saw red. She was absolutely fuming. She was in tears because it was a complete abuse of trust.

“The sofa is gone. There was no way we could let our kids sit on it again knowing what happened. We gave it away for nothing. We just wanted it out of the house as soon as possible.

“I have asked him if he had a girl round at the house and he has completely denied it all to me. But you can clearly see and hear what is going on.

“You can hear slapping noises and sex noises. It’s absolutely disgusting to do that in someone else’s house where children live."

Michael said he has known old school friend Mike for more than ten years so thought he could trust the plumber to be in his house alone.

He flew to Antalya with his wife Becca and their four children on September 22 for a seven-night holiday.

Michael said he asked Mike to fit a vanity unit, ceiling lights and floor tiles in the upstairs bathroom of their house while they were away.

The £570 job was completed before the family returned home, and Mike updated the family with text messages throughout.

(Image: Facebook)

But he claims he noticed a crate of beer had gone missing, so checked the CCTV camera that monitors his driveway.

Cumbria Police has confirmed officers are investigating the allegations and enquiries are ongoing.

Michael said: “I asked the decorator and he said it wasn’t him. Then he said Mike had a girl in the house and sh***ed her on the sofa.

“I rang Mike straight away to ask him and he said ‘no I would never do that, you know me, I’m not like that’.

“I watched the videos back and saw the girl arrive. She was here for a good three hours. You can hear them around the house talking and that and then you can hear sex noises.

"You can hear all-sorts. You can hear slapping noises and groaning. It’s disgusting and I still can’t believe it.

(Image: Facebook)

“He’s denied it all and has blocked me on social media completely.”

But Mike did admit in a text message he had a “friend” round at the house and the pair got “amorous”.

Michael found out the name of the woman involved through one of Mike's friends - understood to be a 37-year-old - and confronted her on Facebook.

She replied in a message that said: "Thanks for breaking up my family."

Michael also sent the recordings to the woman's husband via Facebook messenger. In messages exchanged on Facebook the woman's shocked husband said both Mike and his wife have since admitted it.

When Mike was contacted for comment he said "don't call me again or I'll have to start charging you for my time" and hung up.

He was also contacted via text message but refused to respond.

A Cumbria Police spokesperson said: "Police were contacted on October 2. An allegation of theft of alcohol is under investigation."
description: Cumbria Police were called as Mike Wilson was warned he will not be getting paid because the owners "now need a new sofa"
